00114         inline Profiler &getProfiler();

00117 //For now, as we have not yet ported this to Linux
00118 #ifndef WIN32
00119 #undef PROF_ENABLED
00120 #endif
00121 
00122 #ifdef PROF_ENABLED
00123 
00124 //declarations
00126 #define PROF_DECLARE(STR) namespace Profiling{extern const int STR = getProfiler().getNewIndex(#STR);}
00128 #define PROF_EXTERN(STR) namespace Profiling{extern const int STR;}
00129 
00130 //resetting
00132 #define PROF_RESET(STR) Profiling::getProfiler().reset(Profiling::STR);
00134 #define PROF_RESET_ALL Profiling::getProfiler().resetAll();
00135 
00136 //counting
00138 #define PROF_COUNT(STR) Profiling::getProfiler().count(Profiling::STR);
00139 
00140 //timing
00142 #define PROF_START_TIMER(STR) Profiling::getProfiler().startTimer(Profiling::STR);
00144 #define PROF_STOP_TIMER(STR) Profiling::getProfiler().stopTimer(Profiling::STR);
00146 #define PROF_TIMER_FUNC(STR) Profiling::FunctionTimer fctnTimer__##STR##__(Profiling::getProfiler(),Profiling::STR);
00147 
00148 //printing
00150 #define PROF_PRINT(STR) Profiling::getProfiler().print(Profiling::STR);
00152 #define PROF_PRINT_ALL Profiling::getProfiler().printAll();
00153 
00154 #else
00155 
00156 #define PROF_DECLARE(STR) ;
00157 #define PROF_EXTERN(STR) ;
00158 #define PROF_RESET(STR) ;
00159 #define PROF_RESET_ALL ;
00160 #define PROF_COUNT(STR) ;
00161 #define PROF_START_TIMER(STR) ;
00162 #define PROF_STOP_TIMER(STR) ;
00163 #define PROF_TIMER_FUNC(STR) ;
00164 #define PROF_PRINT(STR) ;
00165 #define PROF_PRINT_ALL ;

00167 #endif

00178 #ifdef WIN32
00179 
00180 #define NOMINMAX
00181 #include <windows.h>
00182 #undef NOMINMAX
00183 
00184 #define UINT64 unsigned __int64
00185 
00186 // Gets time in the highest resolution available to the CPU, about a nanosecond
00187 #define PROF_GET_TIME(STR) LARGE_INTEGER tmp;                     \
00188                                                    QueryPerformanceCounter(&tmp); \
00189                                                    STR = tmp.QuadPart; 
00190 #define PROF_CONVERT_TO_MICROS(RAW,MICROS) MICROS = 1.0e6 * ((double)RAW) / getProfiler().getCountsPerSec();
00191 /*
00192 // Gets time in units of 100 nanoseconds as 2 4-byte words
00193 #define PROF_GET_TIME(STR)  FILETIME tmp;                                       \
00194                                                         GetSystemTimeAsFileTime(&tmp);  \
00195                                                         STR = (static_cast<unsigned __int64>(tmp.dwHighDateTime) << 32) | tmp.dwLowDateTime;
00196 #define PROF_CONVERT_TO_MICROS(RAW,MICROS) MICROS = 0.1 * RAW;
00197 */
00198 #else
00199 // Posix version not yet implemented
00200 #define UINT64 unsigned int
00201 #define PROF_GET_TIME(STR) assert(0);
00202 #define PROF_CONVERT_TO_MICROS(RAW,MICROS) assert(0);
00203 #endif
00204 
00205 namespace Profiling {
00206 
00207 class ProfileInstance {
00208 private:
00209         int mCount;
00210         bool mRunning;
00211         std::string mName;
00213 
00214         UINT64 mStartTime, mElapsedTime;
00215 public:
00216         ProfileInstance();
00217         void setName(char *name){mName = name;}
00218 
00219         void count(){mCount++;}
00220         int getCount(){return mCount;}
00221         void reset(){
00222                 mCount=0;
00223                 mElapsedTime = 0;
00224                 if (mRunning) {
00225                         PROF_GET_TIME(mStartTime);
00226                 }
00227         }
00228         void startTimer(){
00229                 if (!mRunning) {
00230                         PROF_GET_TIME(mStartTime);
00231                         mRunning = true;
00232                 } else {
00233                         std::cerr << "Timer " << mName << " already running.\n";
00234                 }
00235         }
00236         void stopTimer(){
00237                 if (mRunning) {
00238                     UINT64 currentTime;
00239                         PROF_GET_TIME(currentTime);
00240                         mElapsedTime += currentTime - mStartTime;    
00241                         mRunning = false;
00242                 } else {
00243                         std::cerr << "Timer " << mName << " is not running.\n";
00244                 }
00245         }
00253         double getTotalTimeMicroseconds();
00254         void print();
00255 };
00256 
00257 class Profiler {
00258 private:
00259         int mNextIndex;
00260         int mSize;
00261         std::vector<ProfileInstance> mPI;
00262 #ifdef WIN32
00263     UINT64 COUNTS_PER_SEC;
00264 #endif
00265 public:
00266         Profiler();
00267         ~Profiler();
00268 
00269         void resize(int size);
00270         int getNewIndex(char *name);
00271 
00272         void count(int index){mPI[index].count();}
00273         int getCount(int index){return mPI[index].getCount();}
00274         void reset(int index){mPI[index].reset();}
00275         void startTimer(int index){mPI[index].startTimer();}
00276         void stopTimer(int index){mPI[index].stopTimer();}
00277         void print(int index){mPI[index].print();}
00278 
00279         void resetAll();
00280         void printAll();
00281 #ifdef WIN32
00282         UINT64 getCountsPerSec(){return COUNTS_PER_SEC;}
00283 #endif
00284 };
00285 
00286 Profiler& getProfiler(){
00287         //the one and only instance of the profiler
00288         static Profiler profInstance;
00289         return profInstance;
00290 }
00291 
00292 class FunctionTimer {
00293 private:
00294         Profiler &mProfiler;
00295         int mIndex;
00296 public:
00297         FunctionTimer(Profiler &prof, int index) : mProfiler(prof), mIndex(index) {
00298                 mProfiler.count(mIndex);
00299                 mProfiler.startTimer(mIndex);
00300         }
00301         ~FunctionTimer(){mProfiler.stopTimer(mIndex);}
00302 };

00304 }
